newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- sideways ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- sideways ahead of holiday.

text.p: U.S. municipal went sideways as a number of traders opted to start the three-day U.S. Memorial Day weekend early, leaving the market looking ahead to even fewer new issues than were seen this week.
Municipal bond sales for next week were predicted to fall about $1 billion to $2.1 bilion, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
"Volume's going to be kind of light again, and again I think it'll probably bode well for the (market)," a trader said.

On the competitive calender, a $256 million Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority issue on Thursday was the largest. Traders looked for the deal to go well, pointing to a strengthening trend for debt sold by some issuers in that state.
"California is trading at pretty tight spreads, historically," one said. He pegged such debt at around 10 basis points higher than insured paper.

Another trader noted the deal was weighted towards the long end and was the first big competitive deal seen in some time. But he added a note of caution: "I think the bond funds have a limited amount of cash."
Another focus of next week likely will be a nearly $244 million sale of general obligation bonds by the financially strapped District of Columbia.
"It's been awhile since you've seen that credit come to market. If it's insured, it'll probably be 15 basis points off the insured level," speculated a trader.

Although bondholders settled class-action lawsuits alleging securities fraud in the sale of Denver International Airport bonds, according to attorneys, traders said that on a day when trading was as quiet as Friday, outstanding debt showed little reaction.
"I don't think the market ever opened," a trader said, adding participants next week likely would have a better feel for the prices of the airport bonds.
June municipal bond futures rose four ticks to 116-14/32, while June Treasury bonds climbed the same amount to 109-6/32. This left the MOB spread at plus 232 ticks.
Broward County, Florida, Professional Sports Facilities Tax Revenues of 2028, which pay a 5-5/8 percent coupon, were bid at 5.74 percent, NET, unchanged.
Cleveland, Ohio, Certificates of Participation Cleveland Stadium Project of 2027, which carry a 5-1/4 percent coupon, were bid at 5.69 percent, NET, down one basis point.
